title: Li-ion battery with coated electrolyte

events.title: Application filed by Robert Bosch GmbH

classifications.description: Safety or regulating additives or arrangements in electrodes, separators or electrolyte
Selection of substances as active materials, active masses, active liquids of elements or alloys
Composites in the form of layered products, e.g. coatings
Manufacturing or production processes characterised by the final manufactured product
Energy storage systems for electromobility, e.g. batteries
Electric battery cell making including coating or impregnating

claims:
The battery of claim 1, wherein:
the solid electrolyte layer has a thickness of about 100 nm to 50 µm; and
the first protective layer has a nominal thickness of between about 1 nm and 50 nm.

The battery of claim 2, further comprising:
a second protective layer coating an anode facing side of the solid electrolyte layer, the second protective layer formed on the anode facing side in such a manner that a space within the solid electrolyte layer opening to the anode facing side is filled with a second protective layer finger.

The method of claim 4, further comprising:
forming a continuous coating of a second protective layer on a second side of the solid electrolyte layer.

The method of claim 5, wherein positioning the solid electrolyte layer between the anode and the cathode comprises:
positioning the solid electrolyte layer between the anode and the cathode with the second protective layer positioned between the electrolyte layer and the anode.

The method of claim 5, further comprising:
polishing the second protective layer; and
exposing a portion of the second side by polishing the second protective layer.

The method of claim 7, wherein providing the anode comprises:
providing an anode including a form of lithium.

The method of claim 8, wherein providing the cathode comprises:
providing a cathode including a form of sulfur.

The method of claim 4, wherein forming the continuous coating comprises:
forming the continuous coating with a nominal thickness of between about 1 nm and 50 nm.
